publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3650 John Park: Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport—That the Parliament congratulates Donibristle Primary School on winning the title of Dunfermline and West Fife School of the Year for Sport for a second consecutive year; recognises the school’s success in winning the regional indoor athletics finals at Monifieth on 19 February 2009 when the school represented Fife, competing against another seven teams and winning by a margin of 65 points, and applauds the hard work of students and staff at Donibristle Primary School for their ongoing dedication to and achievements in sport.
S3M-3650 Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport (lodged on 9 March 2009) Helen Eadie*, Jamie Hepburn*
S3M-3650 Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport (lodged on 9 March 2009) Aileen Campbell*, Jamie McGrigor*, Karen Whitefield*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Mary Mulligan*
S3M-3650 Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport (lodged on 9 March 2009) Stuart McMillan*, Trish Godman*

S3M-3650 John Park: Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport—That the Parliament congratulates Donibristle Primary School on winning the title of Dunfermline and West Fife School of the Year for Sport for a second consecutive year; recognises the school’s success in winning the regional indoor athletics finals at Monifieth on 19 February 2009 when the school represented Fife, competing against another seven teams and winning by a margin of 65 points, and applauds the hard work of students and staff at Donibristle Primary School for their ongoing dedication to and achievements in sport. Supported by: Helen Eadie, Jamie Hepburn, Aileen Campbell, Jamie McGrigor, Karen Whitefield, Mr Frank McAveety, Mary Mulligan, Stuart McMillan, Trish Godman, Gil Paterson*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3650 Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport (lodged on 9 March 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3650 Donibristle Primary School’s Achievements in Sport (lodged on 9 March 2009) David Stewart*
